intro: Pelecyphora robbinsiorum, commonly known as the Robbins' pelecyphora, is a rare and lesser-known species of flowering plant. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically pale pink to white in color. It is native to specific regions in South America, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
